Repository Name Unauthorized: Women's Missionary Union, Hunt Library and Archives
Notes: The Woman's Missionary Union (WMU), Auxiliary to Southern Baptist Convention, was founded in 1888.  It serves as a mission organization for women, girls, and preschool children in Southern Baptist churches.  The archives collects records of its parent body, material about individuals and programs related to the WMU, women's organizations begun as a result of Southern Baptist missions, and records of the Women's Department of the Baptist World Alliance.  Holdings total approximately 600 cubic feet of archival and manuscript material, including minutes, correspondence, publications, still pictures, motion pictures, and sound recordings.  These records document the founding and development of a major Protestant women's missions organization and illustrate the social life and religious education of southern women and children, theological education for women, and home and foreign missions.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
